title: POP3 Emails kept on Server not downloading to inbox after 1st time even after uninstall-reinstall & deleting app data
content:
NOTE: I finally found out how to solve this. I don't see an option to Delete the question, so instead I'll put the solution here at the top, in case others in the future have the same problem. Thanks.

SOLUTION: If using POP3, you must log onto your google account, and, in the settings area for POP and IMAP and such, there's a place where you need to tick "Enable POP for all mail (even mail that's already been downloaded)". Doing so will have Google send ALL your mail on the server more than just one time if you, for instance, uninstall and reinstall a mail client program, etc. (This is for POP3 usage).

========

At Gmail I have 500+ emails from the last 5 years saved on Gmail's server -- that I want to KEEP there even if I "delete" them from a local mail client.

(1) Installed Thunderbird for the 1st time last night for Gmail. On my Gmail account both IMAP and POP3 are enabled, but when installing Thunderbird for the 1st time I selected POP3 because I want the emails NOT to be deleted off the Google server if I delete them from Thunderbird.

(2) Everything worked okay at first -- this first time I installed Thunderbird, it fetched all 500+ emails from my Google account, new and old.

(3) Then this morning Thunderbird said that it needed to compact my emails. At that point everything went wrong. A LARGE portion of my emails were NO LONG VISIBLE in my inbox even though they were "there". How do I know they were "there"? I did a search/find -- one recent email that no longer showed up had "broccoli" in the subject (was only a few days old). It (along with dozens more emails) no longer showed in the Inbox. But when I did "search" for "broccoli" it found the email. But no matter what I did, that email, and dozens more, did not "show" in the inbox.

(4) Searching for answers, I tried things to fix it (including "repair folder") but no luck. Dozens or hundreds of emails were still no longer visible in my Inbox after the compacting (even though they could be "found" if I did "search" for words inside the email body or title).

(5) Nothing seemed to help, so I decided to first delete the account from Thunderbird, then uninstalled Thunderbird completely. After uninstalling it, I also DELETED the entire "THUNDERBIRD" folder in the "Users/XXX/AppData/Roaming" so that everything Thunderbird would (should) be completely uninstalled/deleted.

(6) Then I installed it again (again selecting POP3) -- but THIS time -- and for each time now I try doing the same thing (uninstalling everything thunderbird, including the appdata folder) Thunderbird will only fetch brand NEW emails -- but none of the 500+ I have on Gmail's server that it fetched the very first time (and I made sure I selected the same options as the first time).

Why? Why isn't it fetching read emails off Google's server, but only unread emails? It fetched them (all of them) the very first time I installed Thunderbird, but not any time after that, no matter how many times I delete the account from Thunderbird, then uninstall Thunderbird, delete the AppData Thunderbird folder, and re-install it.

For an experiment, after uninstalling everything again (including deleting the AppData Thunderbird folder) I installed it again, and this time -- just as a test -- selected IMAP instead of POP3. Doing that had Thunderbird download all 500+ emails correctly -- but I don't want IMAP because there's no setting on either Google or Thunderbird to retain emails on Google's server if they're deleted on Thunderbird (only options as to when they get deleted). With POP3, I have it so I can delete them off Thunderbird but they will still be left on Google's server.

After it worked with IMAP, I then did the whole uninstall & delete the Thunderbird AppData folder, and reinstall it again selecting POP3 -- but again, only 1 NEW email that had come in during that time got fetched by Thunderbird -- none of the 500+ old emails that Thunderbird fetched with POP3 only the very first time I installed it.

Thunderbird fetched ALL emails using POP3 the very first time I installed the program, but then on subsequent uninstall/delete the AppData Folder/reinstall tries, it only fetches a new email that might come in, none of the 500+ it did the first time.

I don't see any option on my Gmail account page that would cause this (to work right on the 1st install but not subsequent ones).

Why is this happening? If I'm going to stick with Thunderbird I'm going to NEED to see a good portion of those 500+ emails in my inbox locally but I want POP3 instead of IMAP because I want to be able to delete them from Thunderbird but not have them deleted from the Google server. It worked the very first install (before compacting caused emails to disappear) but no time after that. Please help!

Thank you! PS: new computer, fresh install of win 11
creator: misterlar99

title: Restore e-mails from Thunderbird to Yahoo/ATT Server Inbox
content:
I recently set up Thunderbird for my ATT/Yahoo e-mail, but either inadvertently, or by default, had "Leave messages on server" checked "For at most 14 days" under the Server Settings. As such, all of my old messages prior to August 14, 2023 are gone off the server. I still have them in Thunderbird, but because I use my iPhone for e-mail as well, I'd like to be able to see those older messages across all my devices.

Is there a way I can reload/upload/restore those older messages from Thunderbird back to my ATT/Yahoo server? I've already updated the "Leave messages on server" to just "Until I delete them," so I should be fine going forward.

Thank you for any assistance you can provide.

Sincerely, Lacoy Loescher
creator: LacoyLoescher

title: How do I import some sent emails from files?
content:
I made the mistake of trying the new supernova TB today, and made the even bigger mistake of forgetting to backup my profile before doing so.

The new version was a disaster, and after wasting far too much time getting things to where they should be, I uninstalled and reinstalled version 102.14.0

I have a backup of my profile from my nightly disk image, so used that when I reverted, and all new incoming messages were downloading from the server.

This means I'm only missing the messages I sent today. I saved these before uninstalling supernova, and now want to import them. I have two mail accounts, and a few sent messages for each.

Following some instructions I found here, I zipped up the files for one of the mail accounts and imported it. However, I can't find these messages anywhere, which looks like it didn't actually import them.

Anyone able to help? Thanks

title: Archive folders not showing since upgrading to the latest Thunderbird
content:
I've been on v102 and decided to give the Supernova version a go.

Installed and restarted TB, but when I expand my Archives folder, instead of seeing all archived messages in a year folder, I only see for the last couple of years. See the attached image.

In the previous version, I could see many more folders, going back to 2005 in one case.

Looking in C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\PROLFILEID.default\Mail\pop3.live.com\Archives.sbd I can see all the files I expect, ie 2005, 2005.msf etc up to 2023 and 2023.msf, but the folders don't show up in TB.

Anyone any idea how I get these folders to show? Thanks

title: Thunderbird 115 and the system tray icon
content: When I open Thunderbird, it dl's mail from the mail server, gmail, and an icon pops up in the system tray, the TB icon, with a red dot that tells me I have mail. When I hover over it it says something like "4 unread messages". In TB 102, after I read all the messages, the red dot would go away until a new message came in, then the dot would come back and hovering would get "1 unread message" Now the red dot is always there after I read all my messages, and as more messages come in, the number goes up, so if I get 3 more messages, and hover over it, it says "7 unread message". This can't be right, but I can't find a setting in Windows 11 or Thunderbird that addresses it. Please advise if you can. Thanks.
creator: rleibforth

title: The Saved Files tab gets reset with a new session
content:
Once upon a time the “Saved Files” tab was persistent in Thunderbird. I used to use it quite a lot, as it is waaaay easier to remember that something arrived via email than remembering or simply going where I saved it. Now it’s almost always blank, there is a rather useless “clear list” button (as it is almost always blank already), and I have to look in the file manager for files. Is there some fix for it? I cannot find any setting regarding it. Something in about:config, maybe?

The expected behavior should be having a persistent list, from session to session, as there is already in Firefox.

I really struggle to understand the logic behind deleting the list by default, why this got changed over time, and if it is for privacy surely there should be some setting for the user?

This is the Linux (ubuntu) version of Thunderbird, 102.13.0 (64-bit)

Thanks in advance, elstellino
creator: elstellino1

title: Thunderbird not responding after v115 update
content:
I have been using flatpak Thunderbird on Linux (PoP!_OS) for some time with no problems, but since the update to 115, Thunderbird regularly freezes with a "Thunderbird not responding" message, and I need to force close the app. Creating an event with the calendar was guaranteed to cause a freeze.

After a complete uninstall with `flatpak uninstall --delete-data Thunderbird` and adding back my mail account, Thunderbird now freezes instantly at launch and is completely unusable.

Any help to solve this would be appreciated.

title: The wordwrap of a new mail triggers on plugin bar Quicktext
content:
Dear,

The wordwrapper that is used while writing a mail triggers on the Quicktext pluginbar.

In other words, When you have a lot of templates within the Quicktext plugin, the text will disappear from the screen when typing a long sentence.

This happens in version 115.0.0 or highter no issues in previous version: 102.9.1

Img1: example with Quicktext You can see that the text disappears from the rightside of the screen

Img2: example without Quicktext The text gets wrapped as it should, the text jumps to the next line
